title: Ancient Cavern

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Ancient Cavern is an area reached from the whirlpool near Otto Godblessed's house. Players must dive into the whirlpool to enter the cavern, which contains many high-level monsters, including a high level metal dragon, the mithril dragon.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Ancient Cavern
Ancient Cavern
Released3 July 2007 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors2
LocationBaxtorian Falls (Kandarin)
InhabitantsVarious
TeleportsGames necklace (Barbarian Outpost)
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Ancient Cavern is an area reached from the whirlpool near Otto Godblessed's house. Players must dive into the whirlpool to enter the cavern, which contains many high-level monsters, including a high level metal dragon, the mithril dragon.

The cavern can only be accessed after the player has completed the first part of Barbarian Firemaking, requiring level 35 Firemaking. After that, the player must ask Otto about making pyre ships, and then will be granted access to the dungeon in order to fulfil the objectives required to make them. If a player dives into the whirlpool before completing these tasks, they will be swept away, losing a small amount of their hitpoints, eventually washing up on the shore near Hadley's house.

Players cannot leave the cavern via the whirlpool. Instead, they may leave by riding on one of two aged logs that can be found near the waterfiends, or by teleporting out.

The Ancient Cavern is "far too damp" to use a Dwarf multicannon.

Contents

  • 1 Introduction
  • 2 Location and travel
  • 3 Rummage skeletons
  • 4 The dragon forge and mithril door
  • 5 Monsters
  • 6 Trivia

Introduction[edit | edit source]

Jumping the whirlpool in order to enter the cavern.

The Ancient Cavern is one of the most dangerous dungeons in RuneScape. All who enter the area should be prepared to face dragons with long-range attacks, and high-level monsters that can attack using more than one combat style.

To access the dungeon the player must have learned about funeral pyre burning, in Barbarian Training from Otto Godblessed. To enter the dungeon, the player must jump into the whirlpool off the platform on the northern shore of the Baxtorian Falls lake. Players cannot jump into the whirlpool with a pet following them. Upon entering the cavern, the player appears on a small platform with stairs to the lower level and can see a mithril dragon off in the distance in another part of the upper level.

A player fighting mithril dragons on the upper level.

On the lower level the biggest danger are the brutal green dragons, whilst on the upper floor the only threat are the mithril dragons. On the lower level there are also wandering barbarian spirits and waterfiends.

A safespot within the cavern. There is a Confused barbarian here, but he is not aggressive.

There is a safe area south of the entrance of the lower level in the middle of the room; it is a large rock with a short passageway on the southeast corner. Keep in mind that not all tiles around the rock are safe, and it may still be possible to be hit by a brutal green dragon's dragonfire here.

Remember, the caves are very dangerous so it is recommended to pack good combat gear, an anti-dragonfire shield, anti fire-breath potions, super sets, teleport runes and high-healing food. A ring of life may or may not help because of the high hits the monsters may deliver.

If players need to escape the dungeon and have no teleport, the only way out is by canoeing on the aged logs floating in the water. This will lead them down an underground river out of the caves that takes them downstream. Home teleports are also a viable option.

A total of 12 mithril rocks can be found on the upper level. None are safe to mine, as mithril dragons roam throughout the upper level. One skeleton warlord is also present on this level, in the south-east area.

Location and travel[edit | edit source]

The whirlpool entrance to the Ancient Cavern is south of the Barbarian Outpost near Baxtorian Falls. Players can get there by walking west from Seers' Village, north from East Ardougne, or east from the Tree Gnome Stronghold. (From the stronghold, players with level 37 Agility can take the shortcut northeast of the Grand Tree; otherwise, the more round-about route through the stronghold's southern gate is necessary.)

Some teleports can be used to get near the whirlpool:

  • A Games necklace can teleport to the Barbarian Outpost. This is quickest way to get to the whirlpool, as it is just south of the Outpost.
  • Barbarian teleport from the Lunar Spellbook. Teleporting between barbarian outpost and Lunar Island provides quick banking during slayer tasks.
  • Players with level 37 Agility can use the Gnome gliders or Spirit trees to travel to the Tree Gnome Stronghold and then use the shortcut north of the Grand Tree to get to the Baxtorian Falls lake. Additionally, players who have completed Monkey Madness II may use the Royal Seed Pod to teleport to the Grand Tree.
  • Players with level 99 Fishing can use the Fishing cape to teleport to Otto's Grotto and run to the whirlpool from there.

Rummage skeletons[edit | edit source]

A pile of old barbarian bones that can be rummaged.

Lower levelled players visiting the cave should be focusing more on the barbarians and avoiding the dragons by rummaging barbarian skeletons on the ground. There is a skeleton just south of the safespot described earlier. Chewed bones can also be obtained easily only from the Mithril dragons.

Rummaging the skeleton may cause 0-22 damage.

Messages and rewards when rummaging skeletons: "You rummage in the sharp, slimy pile of bones in search of something useful...

  • ...you find something and stow it in your pack."
  • ...you find something, but it drops to the floor." (if inventory is full)
    • bones or
    • Mangled bones and maybe an ancient page for the My notes book.
  • ...the bones object." The skeleton will animate into a Skeleton heavy (Lvl 132) or a Skeleton hero (Lvl 149) and attack. Protect from melee can be used.
  • ...but there's nothing remotely valuable."

Skeletons respawn after about 2 minutes and any attacking skeleton will disappear at same time.

The dragon forge and mithril door[edit | edit source]

The dragon forge.

In the south-west corner of the cave lies a set of steps. This leads to a closed off section of the upper level leading to the dragon forge, which was used by dragonkin to forge dragon equipment out of Orikalkum. The forge contains a large basin, 3 dragon heads made out of metal, and many anvils. There are channels in the side of the basin and marks in the floor where lava would flow from the mouths of the dragons and into the basin, then flows out again and runs along the floor, out of the room.

Lighting a dragon head.

During Dragon Slayer II, players reignite the forge by unlocking the mithril door on the upper level using an ancient key found in a dragonkin laboratory underneath Ungael. Inside the mithril door are three hanging dragon heads and a giant orb in the centre. The player must click on each head to light it using Fire Wave or Surge, which will cause them to have fire appear in their mouths.

Once the orb in the chamber is lit, the forge becomes filled with molten lava. During the quest, players reforge the dragon key here, but after the quest, players can smith dragon kiteshields and platebodies by using the appropriate parts.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Waterfiend, level 115

  • Confused barbarian, level 132

  • Lost barbarian, level 132

  • Skeleton brute, level 132

  • Skeleton heavy, level 132

  • Skeleton thug, level 132

  • Skeleton warlord, level 132

  • Skeleton hero, level 149

  • Angry barbarian spirit, level 166

  • Berserk barbarian spirit, level 166

  • Enraged barbarian spirit, level 166

  • Brutal green dragon, level 227

  • Mithril dragon, level 304

The cavern hosts several different high level monsters that all wander the lower level. However, they are not that difficult, sticking to one style of combat that can easily be defended against with Prayer. Waterfiends can use all three combat styles, making them more of a challenge.

Although dragons are often the main interest of the dungeon, many of the other monsters boast high hitpoint and melee stats and players should remain wary. When not in combat, players are still susceptible to surprisingly dangerous attacks. Monsters such as the Waterfiend have caught many adventurers unaware or on the retreat.

The formerly inaccessible area within the Ancient Cavern as seen before the release of Dragon Slayer II.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Upon release, the set of steps at the south-west corner of the cavern's ground level that leads to the dragon forge could not be climbed on, as it was too slippery. If players went to the upper level, a small body of water could be seen, with the steps having an option to climb down.

The '''Ancient Cavern''' is an area reached from the [[Whirlpool (Baxtorian Falls)|whirlpool]] near [[Otto Godblessed]]'s house. Players must dive into the whirlpool to enter the cavern, which contains many high-level monsters, including a high level [[Metal dragons|metal dragon]], the [[mithril dragon]].

The cavern can only be accessed after the player has completed the first part of [[Barbarian Firemaking]], requiring level 35 [[Firemaking]]. After that, the player must ask Otto about making pyre ships, and then will be granted access to the dungeon in order to fulfil the objectives required to make them. If a player dives into the whirlpool before completing these tasks, they will be swept away, losing a small amount of their [[hitpoints]], eventually washing up on the shore near [[Hadley]]'s house.

Players cannot leave the cavern via the whirlpool. Instead, they may leave by riding on one of two aged logs that can be found near the [[waterfiend]]s, or by teleporting out.

The Ancient Cavern is "far too damp" to use a [[Dwarf multicannon]].

==Introduction==
[[File:Whirlpool jump.png|thumb|Jumping the whirlpool in order to enter the cavern.]]
The Ancient Cavern is one of the most dangerous dungeons in ''RuneScape''. All who enter the area should be prepared to face dragons with long-range attacks, and high-level monsters that can attack using more than one combat style.

To access the dungeon the player must have learned about funeral pyre burning, in [[Barbarian Training]] from [[Otto Godblessed]]. To enter the dungeon, the player must jump into the whirlpool off the platform on the northern shore of the [[Baxtorian Falls]] lake. Players cannot jump into the whirlpool with a [[pet]] following them. Upon entering the cavern, the player appears on a small platform with stairs to the lower level and can see a [[mithril dragon]] off in the distance in another part of the upper level.
[[File:Fighting mithril dragons.png|thumb|left|220px|A player fighting mithril dragons on the upper level.]]
On the lower level the biggest danger are the [[brutal green dragon]]s, whilst on the upper floor the only threat are the mithril dragons. On the lower level there are also wandering barbarian spirits and [[waterfiend]]s.

[[File:Ancient cavern safespot.png|thumb|A safespot within the cavern. There is a Confused barbarian here, but he is not aggressive.]]
There is a safe area south of the entrance of the lower level in the middle of the room; it is a large rock with a short passageway on the southeast corner. Keep in mind that not all tiles around the rock are safe, and it may still be possible to be hit by a brutal green dragon's dragonfire here.

Remember, the caves are very dangerous so it is recommended to pack good combat gear, an anti-dragonfire shield, anti fire-breath potions, super sets, teleport runes and high-healing food. A [[ring of life]] may or may not help because of the high hits the monsters may deliver.

If players need to escape the dungeon and have no teleport, the only way out is by canoeing on the aged logs floating in the water. This will lead them down an underground river out of the caves that takes them downstream. Home teleports are also a viable option.

A total of 12 [[mithril rock]]s can be found on the upper level. None are safe to mine, as mithril dragons roam throughout the upper level. One [[skeleton warlord]] is also present on this level, in the south-east area.

==Location and travel==
The whirlpool entrance to the Ancient Cavern is south of the [[Barbarian Outpost]] near [[Baxtorian Falls]]. Players can get there by walking west from [[Seers' Village]], north from [[East Ardougne]], or east from the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]]. (From the stronghold, players with level 37 [[Agility]] can take the shortcut northeast of the [[Grand Tree]]; otherwise, the more round-about route through the stronghold's southern gate is necessary.)

Some teleports can be used to get near the whirlpool:

*A [[Games necklace]] can teleport to the Barbarian Outpost. This is quickest way to get to the whirlpool, as it is just south of the Outpost.
*[[Barbarian Teleport|Barbarian teleport]] from the [[Lunar Spellbook]]. Teleporting between barbarian outpost and Lunar Island provides quick banking during slayer tasks.
*Players with level 37 [[Agility]] can use the [[Gnome glider]]s or [[Spirit tree]]s to travel to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] and then use the shortcut north of the [[Grand Tree]] to get to the Baxtorian Falls lake. Additionally, players who have completed [[Monkey Madness II]] may use the [[Royal seed pod|Royal Seed Pod]] to teleport to the Grand Tree.
*Players with level 99 [[Fishing]] can use the [[Fishing cape]] to teleport to [[Otto's Grotto]] and run to the whirlpool from there.

==Rummage skeletons==
[[File:Skeleton rummage.png|thumb|200px|A pile of old barbarian bones that can be rummaged.]]
Lower levelled players visiting the cave should be focusing more on the barbarians and avoiding the dragons by rummaging barbarian skeletons on the ground. There is a skeleton just south of the safespot described earlier. Chewed bones can also be obtained easily only from the Mithril dragons.

Rummaging the skeleton may cause 0-22 damage.

Messages and rewards when rummaging skeletons:
"You rummage in the sharp, slimy pile of bones in search of something useful...
*...you find something and stow it in your pack."
*...you find something, but it drops to the floor." (if inventory is full)
**[[bones]] or
**[[Mangled bones]] and maybe an [[My notes|ancient page]] for the '''My notes''' book.
*...the bones object." The skeleton will animate into a [[Skeleton heavy]] (Lvl 132) or a [[Skeleton hero]] (Lvl 149) and attack. [[Protect from melee]] can be used.
*...but there's nothing remotely valuable."

Skeletons respawn after about 2 minutes and any attacking skeleton will disappear at same time.

==The dragon forge and mithril door==
[[File:Dragon forge - DS2.png|thumb|The dragon forge.]]
In the south-west corner of the cave lies a set of steps. This leads to a closed off section of the upper level leading to the dragon forge, which was used by [[dragonkin]] to forge [[dragon equipment]] out of [[Orikalkum]]. The forge contains a large basin, 3 dragon heads made out of metal, and many anvils. There are channels in the side of the basin and marks in the floor where lava would flow from the mouths of the dragons and into the basin, then flows out again and runs along the floor, out of the room.
[[File:Dragon fire - DS2.gif|thumb|Lighting a dragon head.]]
During [[Dragon Slayer II]], players reignite the forge by unlocking the mithril door on the upper level using an [[ancient key]] found in a dragonkin laboratory underneath [[Ungael]]. Inside the mithril door are three hanging dragon heads and a giant orb in the centre. The player must click on each head to light it using [[Fire Wave]] or [[Fire Surge|Surge]], which will cause them to have fire appear in their mouths.

Once the orb in the chamber is lit, the forge becomes filled with molten lava. During the quest, players reforge the [[dragon key]] here, but after the quest, players can smith [[dragon kiteshield]]s and [[dragon platebody|platebodies]] by using the appropriate parts.

==Monsters==
<gallery>
Waterfiend.png|[[Waterfiend]], level 115
Confused barbarian.png|[[Confused barbarian]], level 132

Enraged barbarian spirit.png|[[Enraged barbarian spirit]], level 166
Brutal green dragon.png|[[Brutal green dragon]], level 227
Mithril dragon.png|[[Mithril dragon]], level 304
</gallery>

The cavern hosts several different high level monsters that all wander the lower level. However, they are not that difficult, sticking to one style of combat that can easily be defended against with Prayer. Waterfiends can use all three combat styles, making them more of a challenge.

Although dragons are often the main interest of the dungeon, many of the other monsters boast high hitpoint and melee stats and players should remain wary. When not in combat, players are still susceptible to surprisingly dangerous attacks. Monsters such as the Waterfiend have caught many adventurers unaware or on the retreat.
[[File:Ancient Cavern inaccessible steps.png|thumb|250px|The formerly inaccessible area within the Ancient Cavern as seen before the release of [[Dragon Slayer II]].]]

==Trivia==
*Upon release, the set of steps at the south-west corner of the cavern's ground level that leads to the dragon forge could not be climbed on, as it was too slippery. If players went to the upper level, a small body of water could be seen, with the steps having an option to climb down.
